UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Cationicity-enhanced analogues of the antimicrobial peptides, AcrAP1 and AcrAP2, from the venom of the scorpion, Androctonus crassicauda, display potent growth modulation effects on human cancer cell lines.
Literature.Author: Du Q, Hou X, Ge L, Li R, Zhou M, Wang H, Wang L, Wei M, Chen T, Shaw C

Literature.Title: In Vitro and MD Simulation Study to Explore Physicochemical Parameters for Antibacterial Peptide to Become Potent Anticancer Peptide.
Literature.Author: Ma R, Wong SW, Ge L, Shaw C, Siu SWI, Kwok HF

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus NCTC 10788(MIC=8µM),Staphylococcus aureus NCTC 10788(MBC=32µM),Escherichia coli NCTC 10418(MIC=>250µM),Candida albicans NCPF 1467(MIC=16µM),Candida albicans NCPF 1467(MBC=64µM),Human lung carcinoma NCI-H460(no activity data),Human breast adenocarcinoma MDA-MB-435S(no activity data),Human prostate adenocarcinoma PC-3(no activity data),Human breast adenocarcinoma MCF-7(IC50=7.222µM),Human melanoma A375(IC50=9.478µM),Human glioblastoma U87-MG(IC50=10.21)
